meanings.definition: Of or relating to a group of people or things that are foreign or unfamiliar.
meanings.sent1: The travelers were fascinated by the exodic customs of the remote village.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed many exodic artifacts from distant lands.
meanings.sent3: The exodic spices in the dish made it taste surprisingly delicious.
meanings.sent4: Her wardrobe was a mix of exodic colors and patterns, standing out in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The exodic landscape of the desert was unlike anything they had ever seen before.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is exotic or unfamiliar.
meanings.sent1: The zoo had a special exhibit featuring an exodic bird from the rainforest.
meanings.sent2: She felt like an exodic in the bustling city, with her unique style and accent.
meanings.sent3: The little girl thought the new student was an exodic alien from outer space.
meanings.sent4: The antique shop owner considered the rare vase an exodic treasure worth a fortune.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious traveler carried an exodic map leading to hidden treasures.
